TITLE: Installing sphinx_celery using pip
DESCRIPTION: Command to install or upgrade sphinx_celery package using pip package manager. This is the recommended installation method for most users.
SOURCE: https://github.com/celery/sphinx_celery/blob/master/README.rst#2025-04-23_snippet_0

LANGUAGE: bash
CODE:
```
$ pip install -U sphinx_celery
```

----------------------------------------

TITLE: Configuring Sphinx for Celery Documentation in Python
DESCRIPTION: This snippet sets up the Sphinx configuration for the Celery project documentation. It includes various extensions, theme settings, and custom configurations to enhance the documentation output. The configuration also sets up intersphinx mapping and autodoc settings.
SOURCE: https://github.com/celery/sphinx_celery/blob/master/requirements/test.txt#2025-04-23_snippet_0

LANGUAGE: Python
CODE:
```
from sphinx_celery import conf

globals().update(conf.build_config(
    'celery', __file__,
    project='Celery',
    version_dev='5.1',
    version_stable='5.0',
    canonical_url='https://docs.celeryproject.org',
    webdomain='celeryproject.org',
    github_project='celery/celery',
    author='Ask Solem & contributors',
    author_name='Ask Solem',
    copyright='2009-2020',
    publisher='Celery Project',
    html_logo='images/celery_512.png',
    html_favicon='images/favicon.ico',
    html_prepend_sidebars=['sidebardonations.html'],
    extra_extensions=['sphinx.ext.napoleon'],
    apicheck_ignore_modules=[
        'celery.five',
        'celery.fixups',
        'celery.local',
        'celery.contrib',
        'celery.apps',
        'celery.backends.azureblockblob',
        'celery.backends.elasticsearch',
        'celery.events.snapshot',
        'celery.loaders.base',
        'celery.app.base',
        'celery.concurrency.asynpool',
        'celery.utils.abstract',
        'celery.utils.objects',
        'celery.utils.time',
        'celery.db.models',
        'celery.db.session',
        'celery.bin',
        'celery.contrib',
    ],
))

html_theme = 'celery'
html_theme_path = ['_theme']
html_sidebars = {}

requirements = ['celery.rst']
config = [f'configuration/{rfile}' for rfile in requirements]

def setup(app):
    app.add_crossref_type(
        directivename='setting',
        rolename='setting',
        indextemplate='pair: %s; setting',
    )
    app.add_crossref_type(
        directivename='sig',
        rolename='sig',
        indextemplate='pair: %s; sig',
    )
    app.add_crossref_type(
        directivename='state',
        rolename='state',
        indextemplate='pair: %s; state',
    )
    app.add_crossref_type(
        directivename='control',
        rolename='control',
        indextemplate='pair: %s; control',
    )
    app.add_crossref_type(
        directivename='signal',
        rolename='signal',
        indextemplate='pair: %s; signal',
    )
    app.add_crossref_type(
        directivename='event',
        rolename='event',
        indextemplate='pair: %s; event',
    )
```

TITLE: Defining Sphinx Version Requirement
DESCRIPTION: Specifies the minimum required version of Sphinx documentation generator as 2.0.0 or higher
SOURCE: https://github.com/celery/sphinx_celery/blob/master/requirements/default.txt#2025-04-23_snippet_0

LANGUAGE: text
CODE:
```
Sphinx>=2.0.0
```

----------------------------------------

TITLE: Installing sphinx_celery development version with pip
DESCRIPTION: Command to install the latest development snapshot of sphinx_celery directly from GitHub using pip. This method is useful for accessing the latest features and fixes.
SOURCE: https://github.com/celery/sphinx_celery/blob/master/README.rst#2025-04-23_snippet_3

LANGUAGE: bash
CODE:
```
$ pip install https://github.com/celery/sphinx_celery/zipball/master#egg=sphinx_celery
```

----------------------------------------

TITLE: Specifying Python Package Dependencies with Version Requirements
DESCRIPTION: This snippet lists Python package dependencies with their minimum version requirements. It includes setuptools, wheel, flake8, tox, and bumpversion, which are commonly used for Python project development, testing, and versioning.
SOURCE: https://github.com/celery/sphinx_celery/blob/master/requirements/pkgutils.txt#2025-04-23_snippet_0

LANGUAGE: Text
CODE:
```
setuptools>=59.2.0
wheel>=0.37.0
flake8>=4.0.1
tox>=3.24.4
bumpversion
```

TITLE: Installing sphinx_celery from source
DESCRIPTION: Series of commands to download, extract, build, and install sphinx_celery from source package. This method requires downloading the tar file from PyPI first.
SOURCE: https://github.com/celery/sphinx_celery/blob/master/README.rst#2025-04-23_snippet_2

LANGUAGE: bash
CODE:
```
$ tar xvfz sphinx_celery.0.0.tar.gz
$ cd sphinx_celery.0.0
$ python setup.py build
# python setup.py install
```

----------------------------------------

TITLE: Installing sphinx_celery using easy_install
DESCRIPTION: Command to install or upgrade sphinx_celery package using easy_install, an alternative to pip. This method is provided for users who prefer easy_install.
SOURCE: https://github.com/celery/sphinx_celery/blob/master/README.rst#2025-04-23_snippet_1

LANGUAGE: bash
CODE:
```
$ easy_install -U sphinx_celery
```
